Holiday Entitlement [Extract].0: You are entitled to 6.12 weeks' holiday a year (8.6 FTE) which must be taken during the school holidays as set out at clause 6.1. Your annual leave entitlement is inclusive of public holidays in England and Wales. Public holidays which fall during term time are normal working days. Annual leave will be paid as part of your annual salary in accordance with clause 4.1.
Holiday Entitlement [Extract].1: You are entitled to 26 days 'holiday (including bank holidays) during each holiday year (calculated on a pro rata basis by reference to a full-time entitlement of 35 days' holiday each year and the usual 8 public holidays in England and Wales). Public holidays which fall during term time are normal working days. You may be required to work during public holidays (including the August bank holiday). You will be entitled to a day in lieu where we require you to work on a public holiday. You will be paid your normal basic remuneration during such holidays
Holiday Entitlement [Extract].2: You are entitled to 35 working days holiday leave and 8 bank holidays (or days in lieu thereof) each year to be taken at times agreed with the Principal. Bank Holidays that fall during term time are normal working days. You may be required to work other Bank Holidays (including the August Bank Holiday). Worked Bank Holidays may be taken in lieu.
Holiday Entitlement [Extract].3: You are entitled to 6.12 weeks' holiday a year (8.6 FTE) which must be taken during the school holidays as set out at clause 6.1. Holiday Entitlement [Extract].20: You are entitled to the equivalent of 5.6 weeks' holiday during each holiday year (including all bank holiday entitlements), calculated on a pro rata basis depending on the number of hours that you actually work. Your holiday entitlement is therefore equivalent to 12.07% of the hours that you actually work in each holiday year. (So if you worked 10 hours, you would be entitled to 72.6 minutes paid holiday, 12.07/100 x 10 = 1.21 hours = 72.63 minutes). Calculating holiday pay will involve calculating an average week's pay using figures for pay over the preceding 12 weeks.

Public holidays which fall during term time and the Easter revision course are normal working days. You may be required to work during public holidays (including the August bank holiday). You will be paid your normal basic remuneration during such holidays
Holiday Entitlement [Extract].44: 7.1 You are entitled to the equivalent of 5.6 weeks' holiday during each holiday year (including all bank holiday entitlements), calculated on a pro rata basis depending on the number of hours that you actually work. Your holiday entitlement is therefore equivalent to 12.07% of the hours that you actually work in each holiday year. (So if you worked 10 hours, you would be entitled to 72.6 minutes paid holiday, 12.07/100 x 10 = 1.21 hours = 72.63 minutes). Calculating holiday pay will involve calculating an average week's pay using figures for pay over the preceding 12 weeks.
